content.description:
Use one of the main starts (the right side corner crack start is a classic) climb up to the start ledge.  On the right side of the start ledge is an awkward monster offwidth chimney / crack.  Climb up through the chimney / crack (hint stay outside so you dont get stuffed into the top of the chimney / crack). To an outward sloping ledge below the roof, step up right to a good ledge, step 	off to the left and climb up and over the roof.  Or from the ledge you can also climb straight up to the top (this is a less than vertical option to finish on), from either choice continue on to the top.  Or you can walk off to the right side of Pillar #2 toward the rap chains. 

  This is a classic line of Pillar #2 with a roof of only moderate difficulty.

Start in the middle of the narrow west facing wall of Pillar #2.  Climb straight up to the top.  Easier to the left, harder to the right. 

  Note:  The beginning of this route is hard to protect and is the crux, and a bit scary to boot (lots of balance and friction moves).
Climb the right face of the corner.
Start at the base of a small slab, just to the right of Mister Gut Wrench.  Climb the left wall of a right facing corner just left of the corner crack.
Start at the bottom of a great over fist sized crack angling to the right, climb up through the crack to a ledge.  Finish by scrambling up to the top of Pillar #2.

The start is the bottom center of the north-facing wall of Pillar #2. Climb straight up the middle using pinch and crimper holds angling left up the narrowing wall to a ledge on top (stay on the north facing wall), either step off to the left and climb up and over the roof to the top, or walk off to the right side of Pillar #2 toward the descent routes. 

  Note:	Both sides of this wall are off limits for the full effect.

Start at the top left of the sandy gully at a root system of a large pine tree high overhead.  Climb up and over the roots into a chimney, up through the chimney stepping out onto the top of the right (south) side of Pillar #2. 

  This is a popular descent route for all three (3) of the pillars.  It is easily accessible and offers security for the novice descender as well as a quick path down for the more skilled. 

  Caution:   There is some really loose looking stuff on this route.  A simple word of caution, so be careful.
content.protection: None required.  This is popular decent route.

content.description: Start just right of Easter Bunny at the far left of the west facing corner and climb straight up.

Start up the left side of Pillar #2 halfway up the sandy gully at a large ledge that goes out toward the southwest outside corner of Pillar #2 and is the top of the arête on The Alley.  Climb the chimney up to a large ledge and the top of the right side of Pillar #2.
Same start as Bolt Left.  At the ledge, climb the face right of bolt and through center of overhang.
Start at the corner just right of The Great Chimney.  At the ledge, climb the face left of the bolt to the top.

Start at the base of a small slab, climb the inside corner crack up through the bulge to the top to a good ledge.  Finish by scrambling up to the top of Pillar #2 or walk off to the right into the sandy gully that separates Pillar #2 and Calvins Slabs.
The little sister of the crags at White Rock, however, the smallest of the three pillars.  Its overall height is approximately one hundred five (105) vertical feet.
